title: Waste-to-Value and Low-Carbon Infrastructure Leader Nexus PMG Raises $50 Million to Accelerate Its Services and ... - PR Newswire
summary: Nexus PMG, a sustainable infrastructure services company, has raised $125 million in capital to expand its offerings and team. Nexus PMG provides consulting services and develops projects in the low-carbon infrastructure sector, with a focus on waste-to-power conversion and other sustainable solutions.
green_innovation: TRUE. Nexus PMG's work in the low-carbon infrastructure sector contributes to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE. Nexus PMG develops and commercializes new greenfield infrastructure assets, such as renewable natural gas facilities and sustainable aviation fuel production facilities, which are new or improved products or processes.
green_product: TRUE. Nexus PMG's renewable natural gas, compost products, biochar, and sustainable aviation fuel are all examples of goods that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that reduces environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. Nexus PMG's work in the low-carbon infrastructure sector involves the development and implementation of processes that minimize environmental impact, such as converting organic waste streams into renewable natural gas and using carbon sequestration to produce sustainable aviation fuel.
product_or_process: Nexus PMG provides consulting services and develops projects in the low-carbon infrastructure sector, with a focus on waste-to-power conversion and other sustainable solutions.
likely_naics_codes: ['221112 - Fossil Fuel Electric Power Generation', '221113 - Nuclear Electric Power Generation', '221119 - Other Electric Power Generation', '562211 - Hazardous Waste Treatment and Disposal']
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not provide any evidence to suggest that Nexus PMG's products or processes are an example of greenwashing.

title: Antioxidant-packed GM purple tomatoes get FDA green light - AgFunderNews
summary: Norfolk Plant Sciences (NPS) has received a 'no questions' letter from the FDA regarding the safety of its purple tomatoes genetically engineered to produce high levels of health-promoting anthocyanins. The company is now preparing to launch its purple tomatoes in the US, starting with fresh tomatoes and seeds for home gardeners. NPS believes that the FDA's review is an important process for public trust in new products and will support its grower and channel partners in messaging to their customers that the product has been reviewed.
green_innovation: TRUE - The purple tomatoes are a green innovation because they are designed to reduce negative environmental externalities of human activity by promoting health and well-being through increased consumption of fruits and vegetables.
business_innovation: TRUE - The purple tomatoes are a business innovation because they are a new product that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE - The purple tomatoes are a green product because they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle by promoting health and well-being.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not describe a green process.
